title: exercise of the power conferred on me by section 19 of the Control of Dogs Act
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Control of Dogs (XL Bully)
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Control of Dogs (XL Bully) 

(Amendment) Regulations 2025. 

Commencement

title: exercise of the power conferred on me by section 19 of the Control of Dogs Act
heading: 2. These Regulations shall come into operation on 9 June 2025.
text_raw:
2. These Regulations shall come into operation on 9 June 2025. 

Definition

title: exercise of the power conferred on me by section 19 of the Control of Dogs Act
heading: In these Regulations, “Principal Regulations” means the Control of Dogs
text_raw:
3. 

In these Regulations, “Principal Regulations” means the Control of Dogs 

(XL Bully) Regulations 2024 (S.I. No. 491 of 2024). 

Amendment of Regulation 3 of Principal Regulations

title: exercise of the power conferred on me by section 19 of the Control of Dogs Act
heading: 4. Regulation 3 of the Principal Regulations is amended –
text_raw:
4. Regulation 3 of the Principal Regulations is amended – 

(a) 

by the insertion of the following definition: 

“‘Act’ means the Control of Dogs Act 1986 (No. 32 of 1986);”, 
and 

(b) 

in the definition of “relevant XL Bully”, by the insertion of “, 
subject to Regulation 10(2),” after “means”. 

Amendment of Regulation 9 of Principal Regulations
text_norm: 4 regulation 3 principal regulation amended - (a) insertion following definition act mean control dog act 1986 (no 32 1986) (b) definition relevant xl bully insertion subject regulation 10(2) mean  amendment regulation 9 principal regulation

title: exercise of the power conferred on me by section 19 of the Control of Dogs Act
heading: 5. Regulation 9 of the Principal Regulations is amended by the substitution
text_raw:
5. Regulation 9 of the Principal Regulations is amended by the substitution 

of “Regulations 5(4)(b)(iii), 11 and 12” for “Regulation 5(4)(b)(iii)”. 

Amendment of Principal Regulations – insertion of Regulations 10, 11 and 12

title: exercise of the power conferred on me by section 19 of the Control of Dogs Act
heading: 6. The Principal Regulations are amended by the insertion of the following
text_raw:
6. The Principal Regulations are amended by the insertion of the following 

Regulations after Regulation 9: 

“Interpretation – this Regulation, Regulations 11 and 12 and Schedules 5 
to 8
text_norm: 6 principal regulation amended insertion following regulation regulation 9 interpretation - regulation regulation 11 12 schedule 5 8

title: exercise of the power conferred on me by section 19 of the Control of Dogs Act
heading: (1) In this Regulation, Regulations 11 and 12 and Schedules
text_raw:
10. 

(1) In this Regulation, Regulations 11 and 12 and Schedules 
5 to 8 – 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 6th June, 2025. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [214] 3 

‘Regulation 11 decision on review’ means the notice under 
Regulation 11(6); 

‘Regulation 11 notice of no objection’ means the notice under 
Regulation 11(2)(a); 

‘Regulation 11 notice to relevant owner’ means the notice under 
Regulation 11(1); 

‘Regulation 11 review’, in relation to a relevant opinion the subject 
of a Regulation 11 review request, means the review under 
Regulation 11(6) of that opinion; 

‘Regulation 11 review request’ means the request referred to in 
Regulation 11(3)(a); 

‘relevant dog’ means the dog referred to in Regulation 11(1); 

‘relevant dog warden’ means the dog warden referred to in 
Regulation 11(1); 

‘relevant local authority’, in relation to the relevant dog warden, 
means the local authority for which he or she is a dog warden; 

‘relevant opinion’ means the opinion referred to in Regulation 
11(1)(a); 

‘review officer’, in relation to a Regulation 11 review, means the 
person appointed under Regulation 11(4)(b) to conduct the review. 

(2) The reference to an XL Bully in the definition of ‘relevant 
XL Bully’ in Regulation 3 shall, for the purposes of this 
Regulation, Regulations 11 and 12 and Schedules 5 to 8, 
include the relevant dog unless and until the relevant 
opinion is the subject of a Regulation 11 decision on review 
setting aside the opinion. 

Review of relevant opinions
text_norm: 10 (1) regulation regulation 11 12 schedule 5 8 - notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 6th june 2025 214 3 regulation 11 decision review mean notice regulation 11(6) regulation 11 notice objection mean notice regulation 11(2)(a) regulation 11 notice relevant owner mean notice regulation 11(1) regulation 11 review relation relevant opinion subject regulation 11 review request mean review regulation 11(6) opinion regulation 11 review request mean request referred regulation 11(3)(a) relevant dog mean dog referred regulation 11(1) relevant dog warden mean dog warden referred regulation 11(1) relevant local authority relation relevant dog warden mean local authority dog warden relevant opinion mean opinion referred regulation 11(1)(a) review officer relation regulation 11 review mean person appointed regulation 11(4)(b) conduct review (2) reference xl bully definition relevant xl bully regulation 3 shall purpose regulation regulation 11 12 schedule 5 8 include relevant dog unless relevant opinion subject regulation 11 decision review setting aside opinion review relevant opinion

title: exercise of the power conferred on me by section 19 of the Control of Dogs Act
heading: (1) Subject to paragraph (2), where a dog is not the subject of
text_raw:
11. 

(1) Subject to paragraph (2), where a dog is not the subject of 
a certificate of exemption, or an application under Regulation 
7(1) which has not been determined under Regulation 7(2), 
and a dog warden – 

(a) 

is of the opinion that the dog is an XL Bully, and 

(b) has exercised his or her power under Regulation 9(a) 

to seize and detain the dog, 

he or she shall, as soon as is practicable after such seizure and 
detention, issue to the relevant owner of the dog a notice in the 
form set out in Schedule 5. 

(2) 

(a) Subject to subparagraph (b), paragraph (1) shall not 
apply where the relevant owner of the relevant dog gives 
a notice, in the form set out in Schedule 6, to the relevant 
local authority (or the relevant dog warden on behalf of 
the relevant local authority) that he or she has no 

 
 4 [214] 

(3) 

objection to the relevant dog warden exercising his or 
her powers under Regulation 9 in relation to the dog. 

(b) Where the relevant local authority receives a notice 
of no objection from the relevant owner subsequent 
to the issue of the Regulation 11 notice to relevant 
owner, paragraphs (3) to (8) shall not apply. 

(a) Subject to subparagraph (b) and Regulation 12, where 
the relevant owner of the relevant dog is of the opinion 
that the dog is not an XL Bully, he or she may, not later 
than 21 days after the date of issue of the Regulation 11 
notice to relevant owner, make a request, in the form set 
out in Schedule 7, to the relevant local authority to 
review the relevant opinion. 

(b) The relevant owner’s grounds (if any) for his or her 
opinion referred to in subparagraph (a) may be set out 
in the Regulation 11 review request, set out in a 
subsequent document or documents given to the 
relevant local authority before the expiration of the 21 
days referred to in that subparagraph or set out by 
being split between such request and such document 
or documents. 

(c) Any subsequent document or documents referred to 
in subparagraph (b) shall be deemed to be part of the 
Regulation 11 review request and references in these 
Regulations to such request shall, with all necessary 
modifications, be construed accordingly. 

(4) 

(a) Where the relevant local authority receives a Regulation 
11 review request, it shall, as soon as is practicable, 
cause the relevant dog to be returned to the relevant 
owner pending the outcome of the Regulation 11 review. 

(b) Subject to subparagraph (c), where the relevant local 
authority receives a Regulation 11 review request, it 
shall, as soon as is practicable, appoint a person who 
is a veterinary practitioner registered under Part 4 of 
the Veterinary Practice Act 2005 (No. 22 of 2005) to 
conduct the Regulation 11 review. 

(c) The review officer shall neither – 

(i) 

be a dog warden, nor 

(ii) have taken part, in any capacity, in the forming 
of the relevant opinion or the seizing and 
detaining of the relevant dog under Regulation 
9(a). 

(5) Subject to paragraph (8), where the relevant dog is returned 
to the relevant owner pursuant to paragraph (4)(a), the 
owner – 

 [214] 5 

(a) 

shall not permit the dog to be in a public place unless 
the dog is – 

(i) 

being led by means of a sufficiently strong 
chain or leash not exceeding two metres in 
length by a person over the age of 16 years who 
is capable of controlling the dog, and 

(ii) 

securely muzzled in a manner which prevents 
the dog from biting, 

(b) 

shall ensure that – 

(i) 

(ii) 

the premises at which the dog is kept are 
appropriate for the welfare of the dog, and 

such premises are secured in a manner which 
prevents the dog from escaping therefrom, and 

(c) without prejudice to the operation of Regulation 
8(1)(c), shall not dispose of the dog (whether by sale 
or otherwise) unless and until the dog is the subject of 
a Regulation 11 decision on review setting aside the 
relevant opinion. 

(a) The review officer shall, not later than 28 days after the 
expiration of the 21 days referred to in paragraph (3)(a), 
consider the grounds stated in the Regulation 11 notice 
to relevant owner as to why the relevant dog warden is 
of the relevant opinion and the grounds (if any) stated in 
the Regulation 11 review request as to why the relevant 
owner is of the opinion that the dog is not an XL Bully 
and, by notice in the form set out in Schedule 8 given to 
the relevant owner and the relevant dog warden – 

(i) 

confirm the relevant opinion, or 

(ii) 

set aside the relevant opinion. 

(b) The review officer may, for the purposes of 
considering the grounds stated in the Regulation 11 
notice to relevant owner as to why the relevant dog 
warden is of the relevant opinion and the grounds (if 
any) stated in the Regulation 11 review request as to 
why the relevant owner is of the opinion that the dog 
is not an XL Bully, with the consent of the relevant 
owner, examine the relevant dog. 

(6) 

(7) Where the relevant dog – 

(a) was born before 10 December 2024, and 

(b) 

is the subject of a Regulation 11 decision on review 
confirming the relevant opinion, 

the relevant owner (for the avoidance of doubt, being such 
owner referred to in subparagraph (a), (b) or (c) of 
paragraph (2) of Regulation 5) may make an application for 

 6 [214] 

a certificate of exemption for the dog not later than 28 days 
after the Regulation 11 decision on review was issued to 
him or her, and the provisions of Regulation 7 shall, with 
all necessary modifications, be construed accordingly. 

(8) Without prejudice to the operation of any provision of the 
Act or of any provision of another statutory instrument 
made under the Act, where the relevant dog is the subject 
of a Regulation 11 decision on review setting aside the 
relevant opinion, paragraph (5)(a) and (b) shall cease to 
apply to the relevant dog. 

(9) The forms set out in Schedules 5 and 7 may be combined 

into one form. 

(10) For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that this 
Regulation does not again apply where the relevant dog is 
the subject of a Regulation 11 decision on review 
confirming the relevant opinion. 

Where relevant dog is seized and detained from person other than relevant 
owner

(i) confirm relevant opinion (ii) set aside relevant opinion (b) review officer may purpose considering ground stated regulation 11 notice relevant owner relevant dog warden relevant opinion ground (if any) stated regulation 11 review request relevant owner opinion dog xl bully consent relevant owner examine relevant dog (6) (7) relevant dog - (a) born 10 december 2024 (b) subject regulation 11 decision review confirming relevant opinion relevant owner (for avoidance doubt owner referred subparagraph (a) (b) (c) paragraph (2) regulation 5) may make application 6 214 certificate exemption dog later 28 day regulation 11 decision review issued provision regulation 7 shall necessary modification construed accordingly (8) without prejudice operation provision act provision another statutory instrument made act relevant dog subject regulation 11 decision review setting aside relevant opinion paragraph (5)(a) (b) shall cease apply relevant dog (9) form set schedule 5 7 may combined one form (10) avoidance doubt hereby declared regulation apply relevant dog subject regulation 11 decision review confirming relevant opinion relevant dog seized detained person relevant owner

title: exercise of the power conferred on me by section 19 of the Control of Dogs Act
heading: (1) Subject to paragraph (2), where the relevant dog has been
text_raw:
12. 

(1) Subject to paragraph (2), where the relevant dog has been 
seized and detained from a person other than the relevant 
owner, the 21 days referred to in Regulation 11(3)(a) shall not 
begin to efflux until 14 days has expired since the date on 
which the dog was seized and detained, and the provisions of 
Regulation 11 shall, with all necessary modifications, be 
construed accordingly. 

(2) Paragraph (1) shall cease to apply where, before the 
expiration of the 14 days referred to in that paragraph, the 
relevant local authority receives a Regulation 11 notice of 
no objection, or Regulation 11 review request, from the 
relevant owner.”. 

Amendment of Principal Regulations – insertion of Schedules 5 to 8

title: exercise of the power conferred on me by section 19 of the Control of Dogs Act
heading: 7. The Principal Regulations are amended by the insertion of the following
text_raw:
7. The Principal Regulations are amended by the insertion of the following 

Schedules after Schedule 4: 

 
 
 
 
 
 Regulations 10 and 11 

“SCHEDULE 5 

REGULATION 11 NOTICE TO RELEVANT OWNER 

[214] 7 

[Name of local authority] 

[Address] 

[Telephone Number] 

[e-mail address] 

Notice Number 

To the dog owner listed below: 

Name of Owner 

Address 

Eircode 

On the day of the month of 20 , at the location of , 

I, acting as a dog warden for the local authority of formed 
the opinion that the dog listed below is an XL Bully type dog and seized and 
detained the dog under Regulation 9 (a) of the Control of Dogs (XL Bully) 
Regulations 2024. 

Dog Licence Number 

Microchip Number 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 8 [214] 

Sex of Dog 

Colour of Dog 

Based on the characteristics listed in Schedule 1 of S.I. No. 491 of 2024, I have 
formed the opinion that the dog substantially meets the physical conformation 
standard and in the case that the dog has not attained the age of 18 months, has 
the potential to do so on or after attaining that age. This forms the basis for my 
decision to seize the dog. 

I have reasonable grounds to believe that no Certificate of Exemption has been 
granted for the dog listed above, as evidence that the dog listed above is the 
subject of a Certificate of Exemption has not been provided to me within the 
required timeframe. If the dog is less than 18 months of age, evidence of 
application for a Certificate of Exemption to the relevant local authority has not 
been provided to me within the required timeframe. 

Characteristic 

Description 

Does Not 
Conform 
with 
Characteristic 

Conforms 
with 
Characteristic 
to Some 
Extent 

Substantially 
Conforms 
with 
Characteristic 

General 
impression 

Height 

Large dog with a 
muscular body and 
blocky head, 
suggesting great 
strength and 
power for its size. 
Powerfully built 
individual. 

• Adult male from 
51 cm (20 inches) 
at the withers. 

• Adult female 
from 48 cm (19 
inches) at the 
withers. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [214] 9 

Head 

Teeth 

Neck 

Forequarters 

Heavy, large and 
broad. 

The length from 
the tip of the nose 
to a well-defined 
stop (indentation 
between muzzle 
and the head) is 
equal to around 
one-third of the 
length from the tip 
of the nose to the 
back of the head. 

Muzzle blocky or 
slightly squared to 
fall away below 
the eyes. 

Topline of muzzle 
straight. 

Prominent cheek 
muscles with 
strong, welldefined jaws and 
lips semi-close. 

Often having 
prominent 
wrinkles on face. 

Nose is large with 
well opened 
nostrils. 

Level or scissor 
bite. 

Heavy, muscular, 
slightly arched, 
tapering from the 
shoulders to the 
base of the skull. 

Medium in length. 

Shoulder blades 
are long, wellmuscled and well 
laid back. 

Upper arm length 
is about equal to 
the length of the 
shoulder blades 
and joined at a 35-

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 10 [214] 

45 degree angle to 
the ground. 

Front legs straight, 
strong and very 
muscular with dog 
standing high on 
the pasterns. (area 
between feet and 
ankles). 

Elbows set close 
to the body. 

Distance from the 
withers to elbows 
about the same as 
the distance from 
the elbow to the 
bottom of the feet. 

Body 

Heavily-muscled. 

Large, blocky 
body giving 
impression of 
great power for 
size. 

Broad, deep chest 
with well sprung 
ribs. 

Chest may be 
wider than deep. 

Topline level and 
straight. 

Loin short and 
firm. 

Generally appears 
square shaped 
from point of the 
shoulder to the 
point of the 
buttocks compared 
with the withers 
(tallest point on 
the dog’s body 
excluding head 
and shoulders) to 
the ground. 

Hindquarters Strong, muscular 

and broad. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [214] 11 

Thighs well 
developed with 
thick musculature. 

From behind, both 
pasterns are 
typically straight 
and parallel to 
each other. 

Muscular 
development, 
angulation and 
width in balance 
with forequarters. 

Rounded, medium 
in size and in 
proportion to 
body. 

Compact and well 
arched. 

Medium length 
and low set. 

Tapers to a point 
to end at about the 
level of the hocks. 

Generally assumes 
a straight or pump 
handle shape when 
dog relaxed. 

Feet 

Tail 

Coat 

Glossy, smooth, 
close, single. 

Supplementary Evidence to Support Decision of Dog Warden 

(attach any photos / description of markings on dog / evidence that no Certificate 

of Exemption has been obtained for dog, etc.) 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 12 [214] 

Additional Comments of Dog Warden 

(include any other relevant comments below) 

Yours Sincerely, 

Name of Dog Warden (Block Capitals) 

Signature of Dog Warden 

Date of Signature of Dog Warden 

Use DD/MM/YYYY format 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [214] 13 

Regulations 10 and 11

title: exercise of the power conferred on me by section 19 of the Control of Dogs Act
heading: REGULATION 11 NOTICE OF NO OBJECTION
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 6 

REGULATION 11 NOTICE OF NO OBJECTION 

[Name of local authority] 

[Address] 

[Telephone Number] 

[e-mail address] 

I , owner of the dog listed in the Regulation 11 Notice to 
Relevant Owner, Notice Number 
, confirm that I do not 
object to the dog warden exercising their power under Regulation 9 of the 
Control of Dogs (XL Bully) Regulations 2024. 

I understand that the dog will be destroyed in a humane manner, and by signing 
this document I confirm that I understand I have no right to seek a further review 
of the opinion of the dog warden that the dog is an XL Bully type dog. 

Regulation 9 of S.I. No. 491 of 2024 - Control of Dogs (XL Bully) Regulations 
2024 

Destruction in humane manner of XL Bully not subject of certificate of exemption

title: exercise of the power conferred on me by section 19 of the Control of Dogs Act
heading: 9. Subject to Regulation 5(4)(b)(iii), on and after 1 February 2025, a dog
text_raw:
9. Subject to Regulation 5(4)(b)(iii), on and after 1 February 2025, a dog 

warden may – 

(a) 

seize and detain an XL Bully which is not the subject of a 
certificate of exemption, and 

(b) destroy, or cause to be destroyed, in a humane manner, such XL 

Bully. 

Name of Dog Owner (Block Capitals) 

Signature of Dog Owner 

Date of Signature of Dog Owner 

Use DD/MM/YYYY format 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 14 [214] 

Regulations 10 and 11

title: exercise of the power conferred on me by section 19 of the Control of Dogs Act
heading: REGULATION 11 DECISION ON REVIEW
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 8 

REGULATION 11 DECISION ON REVIEW 

[Name of local authority] 

[Address] 

[Telephone Number] 

[e-mail address] 

Notice Number 

Review Number 

Decision Number 

I, having considered the grounds stated in the Regulation 11 Notice To Relevant 
Owner, Notice Number 
 , as to why the dog warden is of 
the opinion the dog is an XL Bully type dog that is not the subject of a Certificate 
of Exemption, and, having considered the grounds stated in the Regulation 11 
Review Request, Review Number 
 , as to why the 
owner is of the opinion the dog is not an XL Bully type dog, make the following 
binding decision. 

(Delete As Applicable) 

I ( confirm / set aside ) the opinion of the dog warden that the dog is an XL Bully 
type dog. 

The grounds to support the binding decision are as follows: 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 16 [214] 

Yours Sincerely, 

Name of Review Officer (Block Capitals) 

Signature of Review Officer 

Date of Signature of Review Officer 

Use DD/MM/YYYY format 

” 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

28 May, 2025. 

DARA CALLEARY, 

Minister for Rural and Community Development.
